main event: Four yellow star-shaped objects were observed hovering silently in Waterville and Morrisville, Vermont for approximately 2 hours on May 13, 1956.
interesting points: The objects were described as being shaped like stars and yellow in color,The observation lasted for about 2 hours,The objects hovered without any sound or exhaust,The sighting was confirmed through binocular observations,Investigators concluded that the sightings were likely caused by clusters of weather balloons.
witness description: Mr. Wilcox, a Lathe Operator with no previous experience as a trained observer
